dataset_id: SAFARI 2000 Gas Emissions from Biofuel Use and Production, September 2000
title: SAFARI 2000 Gas Emissions from Biofuel Use and Production, September 2000
summary: Domestic biomass fuels (biofuels) are estimated to be the second largest source of carbon emissions from global biomass burning. Wood and charcoal provide approximately 90% and 10% of domestic energy in tropical Africa, respectively. As part of the Southern Africa Regional Science Initiative (SAFARI 2000), the University of Montana participated in both ground-based and airborne campaigns during the southern African dry season of 2000 to measure trace gas emissions from biofuel production and use and savanna fires, respectively.
